qas.question: Who did the Ming appoint titles to?
What didn't the Ming send to replace the Mongols when they left Tibet?
What does Yiu Yung-chin claim the Ming did not possess?

context: Laird writes that the Ming appointed titles to <a0_0>eastern <a2_0>Tibet<a2_0/>an princes<a0_0/>, and that "these alliances with eastern Tibetan principalities are the evidence China now produces for its assertion that the Ming ruled Tibet," despite the fact that the Ming did not send <a1_0>an army<a1_0/> to replace the Mongols after they left Tibet. Yiu Yung-chin states that the furthest western extent of the Ming dynasty's territory was Gansu, Sichuan, and Yunnan while "the Ming did not possess Tibet."
